appendix.title: Tag reference
appendix.para: This section outlines each of the available tags showing what attributes they support and gives examples of their use.

section.title: action-button
section.para: Creates an empty form with just a button that invokes the specified method when pressed, forwarding the results to the specified view.

row.entry: Identifier for a specific object, or a service identifier prefixed by "service:".
Method on the object or service to invoke when the user presses the submit button.
View to be forwarded to after submission and an object is returned.
View to be forwarded to after submission and no object is returned.
Name of variable to store the resultant object.
How long the variable should be kept for.

section.para: The action-button element can contain one or more parameter elements.
The following example creates an HTML form with no visible fields and a button that invokes the myRecentClaims method on the claims services when the button is pressed.
See also: , and

section.title: action-form
section.para: Creates a form with entry fields for each of the action's parameters. When the user presses the submit button the action will be invoked, if all the parameter are valid, and the result forwarded to the specified page. If the parameters are invalid control will be forwarded to the specified error page.
If the specified action is not visible or usable no form will be displayed.

row.entry: Identifier for a specific object, or a service identifier prefixed by "service:".
Method on the object or service to invoke when the user has provided the necessary parameters in the generated form and has pressed the submit button.
View to be forwarded to after submission and an object is returned.
View to be forwarded to after submission and no object is returned.
View to be forwarded to after validation failure prevents the action from being invoked.
Name of variable to store the resultant object.
How long the results variable should be kept for.

section.para: The action-form element can contain one or more of the following elements

The following example creates an HTML form that will provide fields for each of the parameters of the createNewClaim method on the claims service. When the submit button is pressed the method will be invoked with the provided fields and the generic form will be used (as no view attribute was specified) to display the result.
See also: , and

section.title: action-link
section.para: Creates a hyper-link that will run the specified method, when the user clicks the link, and will forward the result to the specified view. This tag should only be used for actions that do not change the state of the system as hyper-links are for accessing information not processing data.

row.entry: Identifier for a specific object, or a service identifier prefixed by "service:".
Method on the object or service to invoke when the user clicks the link.
View to be forwarded to after the method has be executed.
Name of variable to store the resultant object.
How long the variable should be kept for.
To be implemented - not in use yet!

section.para: The action-link element can contain one or more parameter elements
The following example creates a hyper-link of the text "Show All Recent Claims", and will execute the method myRecentClaims on the claims service when the user clicks on it.
See also: , and

section.title: action-name
section.para: Provides the name of the specified action on an object or service. This will be name derived from the method or a proper name added to the method via the programming model. Additionally, if the system is set to internationalized the name and descriptions then the returned name will be the localized version.

row.entry: Identifier for a specific object, or a service identifier prefixed by "service:".
Method on the object or service to find the name for.

section.para: The following example finds the name for the createNewExpenseItem method on the object reference by the claim variable.

section.title: collection
section.para: The collection element iterates over a collection outputting the contents of the contained block for each element in the collection.

row.entry: Identifier for a specific collection. If the field attribute is set then the collection will be ignored.
Name of the field to get the collection from within the specified object.
The name of the variable to assign the rows object ID to when the row is selected.

section.para: The collection element can contain one or more of the following

The following example creates an HTML table by creating a row for each element in the collection. The collection that is being used is from the items field in the claim object as referenced by the claim variable. The current element is stored in the variable entry.
See also: , and

section.title: content
section.para: The content element marks the point within a template file (see ) where the generated content will be placed when it is produced. This element is only processed when a template element is being processed, and should only occur with a template file.

section.para: Displays some basic diagnostic information, such as the URI and set variables, when debug flag is set. To set the debug flag append &debug=on to a URL, to turn off append &debug=off.

section.title: initialize
section.para: Conditionally sets up a variable when the current RESULT state is set and matches the specified type. If the RESULT state is not set or the type is not the one specified then the variable is not changed/set.

If the RESULT state is not set or the type is not the one specified then and the a variable already exists for the specified name, but with a different scope, then that value is copied across to a variable with the specified scope.
The following will set up the claim variable for the session if the RESULT is a claim object. If the RESULT is not a claim object then the variable will not be set.

row.entry: How long the variable should be kept for
The class name of the type of object that should be used to initialize the variable. This is used to check that RESULT reference is of the correct type.

section.title: unless
section.para: Processes the contained block when the specified condition is not met.
One of set, field-editable, field-set, empty, or field-empty should be specified, but no more than one.

row.entry: If this attribute is specified but evaluates an empty string then the block will be processed; if non-empty the block is skipped.
If the collection referenced by this attribute contains any elements then the body of this block will not be processed
Identifier for a specific object when specifying one of the field- attributes.
Name of the field within the specified object that should not be editable.
Name of boolean field within the object to check; the block is processed if the boolean value is false.
If the field of the specified object is empty - has no reference or the collection has no elements - this block will not be processed.

section.title: variable
section.para: The variable element assigns the content of the element to a variable held on the server.

row.entry: Name of file to read in
How long the variable should be kept for

section.para: The variable element can contain one or more of the following elements
The following example assigns the dateCreated property to the date variable, which will be accessible for the remainder of the request. Within the page the variable can be accessed via ${date}.

note.para: While this tag processes the contained elements it also includes any text or HTML tags. The text may includes white space and line feeds so care is needed if the variable is to be used in textual context as these characters will be displayed also. To avoid this problem place the variable start and end tags on the same line and only add spaces and new lines where they will be needed when the variable is used.
This is not, however, an issue when the variable is used to reference an object as Scimpi will remove any leading and trailing spaces from the variable first.

section.para: See also: , and

If the collection referenced by this attribute contains any elements then the body of this block will be processed.

Name of the field within the specified object that should be editable.
Name of boolean field within the object to check; the block is processed if the boolean value is true.
If the field of the specified object is empty - has no reference or the collection has no elements - this block will be processed.
